description: Patient readmitted due to uncontrolled pain post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient was discharged on POD 2 after scoliosis correction surgery. On POD 5, the patient returned with complaints of uncontrolled pain in the lower back. Pain management plan was not adequately communicated during discharge. An increase in analgesic requirement was noted.

items.substring: returned with complaints of uncontrolled pain in the lower back.
An increase in analgesic requirement was noted.
Pain management plan was not adequately communicated during discharge.

description: Patient readmitted due to surgical site infection after discharge.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient was discharged on POD 3 following an uncomplicated scoliosis surgery. On POD 10, the patient presented with erythema and drainage from the surgical site, indicating a potential surgical site infection. Antibiotic prophylaxis timing was not documented during the surgery.

items.substring: presented with erythema and drainage from the surgical site.
indicating a potential surgical site infection.
Antibiotic prophylaxis timing was not documented during the surgery.

description: Patient readmitted due to hardware complication.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient underwent scoliosis surgery on POD 0. On POD 7, the patient returned with complaints of significant back pain and was found to have hardware dislodgment on imaging. There was a lack of OR availability for timely follow-up.

items.substring: returned with complaints of significant back pain.
found to have hardware dislodgment on imaging.
There was a lack of OR availability for timely follow-up.

description: Patient readmitted due to GI complication post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient was discharged on POD 4 after scoliosis surgery. On POD 11, the patient presented with symptoms of ileus. The discharge instructions regarding bowel regimen were unclear, leading to the complication.

items.substring: presented with symptoms of ileus.
symptoms of ileus.
The discharge instructions regarding bowel regimen were unclear.

description: Patient readmitted due to pneumonia after surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient had scoliosis surgery on POD 0 and was discharged on POD 2. On POD 9, the patient presented with respiratory distress and was diagnosed with pneumonia. The discharge instructions did not emphasize the importance of deep breathing exercises post-operatively.

items.substring: presented with respiratory distress.
diagnosed with pneumonia.
The discharge instructions did not emphasize the importance of deep breathing exercises.

description: Conflicting notes regarding the patient's pain level post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient reports pain level as 6 out of 10, requiring increased analgesics.

notes.author: RN
notes.text: Patient denies any pain and is comfortable, no additional analgesics required.

items.substring: requiring increased analgesics
Patient denies any pain

description: Conflicting reports on the necessity of reoperation due to hardware issues.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient may need reoperation due to potential hardware complications.

notes.author: Surgeon
notes.text: Hardware is stable; no indication for reoperation at this time.

items.substring: may need reoperation due to potential hardware complications
no indication for reoperation at this time

description: Conflicting assessments about the patient's infection status.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Wound shows signs of erythema and drainage; possible surgical site infection.

notes.author: RN
notes.text: Wound is clean and dry, no signs of infection noted.

items.substring: possible surgical site infection
no signs of infection noted

description: Conflicting notes on the patient's discharge instructions clarity.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Discharge instructions provided; patient understands medication and follow-up.

notes.author: RN
notes.text: Patient seems confused about medication dosing and follow-up appointments.

items.substring: patient understands medication and follow-up
seems confused about medication dosing

description: Conflicting assessments regarding the patient's neurovascular status post-op.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Neurovascular exam indicates normal perfusion; no concerns noted.

notes.author: RN
notes.text: Patient exhibits delayed capillary refill and paresthesia in the lower extremities.

items.substring: normal perfusion; no concerns noted
delayed capillary refill and paresthesia

description: Patient with conflicting notes regarding post-operative pain management.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient reports pain at a level of 8 out of 10, requiring an increase in analgesics.

notes.author: Nurse
notes.text: Patient reports pain is well-controlled at a level of 3 out of 10, no need for additional medication.

items.substring: requiring an increase in analgesics.
no need for additional medication.

description: Conflicting notes on surgical site infection signs post-op.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Wound shows erythema and purulent drainage, indicating possible infection.

notes.author: Nurse
notes.text: Wound appears clean with no signs of infection; no erythema observed.

items.substring: indicating possible infection.
no signs of infection; no erythema observed.

description: Contradicting assessments of neurological function post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Neurovascular exam shows normal sensation and motor function in lower extremities.

notes.author: Nurse
notes.text: Patient reports numbness in right leg, requiring further evaluation.

items.substring: normal sensation and motor function.
reports numbness in right leg.

description: Conflicting documentation on discharge instructions clarity.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Discharge instructions provided; patient educated on medication and activity restrictions.

notes.author: Nurse
notes.text: Patient appears confused about discharge instructions; needs clarity on medication schedule.

items.substring: patient educated on medication and activity restrictions.
Patient appears confused about discharge instructions.

description: Conflicting notes regarding post-operative complications.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient exhibits signs of GI obstruction, requiring immediate intervention.

notes.author: Nurse
notes.text: Patient denies nausea or abdominal pain; no signs of obstruction noted.

items.substring: requiring immediate intervention.
no signs of obstruction noted.

description: Patient experiences conflicting notes regarding post-operative pain management.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient reports pain at a level of 8/10 and requires increasing doses of analgesics.

notes.author: NP
notes.text: Patient reports pain is well-controlled at 4/10 after recent medication adjustment.

items.substring: requires increasing doses of analgesics
pain is well-controlled at 4/10

description: Conflicting documentation about the patient's neurovascular status.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Neurovascular exam reveals intact sensation and strong pulses.

notes.author: RN
notes.text: Patient exhibits decreased sensation in the left foot and weak pulses.

items.substring: intact sensation and strong pulses
decreased sensation in the left foot and weak pulses

description: Conflicting notes on the presence of wound drainage.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Wound examination shows no signs of drainage or erythema.

notes.author: PA
notes.text: Wound drainage noted with mild erythema around the incision site.

items.substring: no signs of drainage or erythema
Wound drainage noted with mild erythema

description: Contradicting notes about the timing of antibiotic prophylaxis.

notes.author: SURGEON
notes.text: Antibiotic prophylaxis given 30 minutes prior to incision.

notes.author: CRNA
notes.text: Antibiotic administration occurred after the incision was made.

items.substring: given 30 minutes prior to incision
after the incision was made

description: Dissonance regarding discharge instructions clarity.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Discharge instructions provided were clear and comprehensive.

notes.author: RN
notes.text: Patient reports confusion regarding discharge instructions.

items.substring: clear and comprehensive
confusion regarding discharge instructions

description: Patient presented with unrelated symptoms post-surgery leading to unnecessary admission.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient was admitted for back pain post-surgery. After evaluation, it was determined that the pain was due to muscle strain unrelated to the surgical site. No signs of infection or hardware issues were noted.

items.substring: admitted for back pain post-surgery

description: Patient experienced nausea and vomiting unrelated to surgery, leading to an extended hospital stay.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Post-operative patient reported nausea and vomiting, which was diagnosed as a viral gastroenteritis unrelated to the scoliosis surgery. The surgical site was clean, and no complications were identified.

items.substring: nausea and vomiting unrelated to the scoliosis surgery

description: Patient's symptoms of anxiety and panic unrelated to surgical recovery led to unplanned admission.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Following scoliosis surgery, the patient exhibited symptoms of anxiety and panic attacks. Evaluation revealed that these symptoms were not related to the surgical procedure, and the surgical recovery was progressing without issues.

items.substring: symptoms of anxiety and panic attacks

description: Patient presented with a pre-existing condition that required admission unrelated to scoliosis surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Post-operative evaluation showed the patient was experiencing chest pain due to a known history of asthma exacerbation. The surgical site was stable, and there were no complications from the scoliosis procedure.

items.substring: experiencing chest pain due to a known history of asthma exacerbation

description: Patient's unrelated skin rash led to an unnecessary hospital admission post-surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: The patient developed a rash on the abdomen which was determined to be an allergic reaction to medication. Evaluation confirmed the surgical site was clean, with no signs of infection or complications.

items.substring: developed a rash on the abdomen which was determined to be an allergic reaction

description: Patient with abdominal pain unrelated to surgical site after scoliosis surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient presented with severe abdominal pain and was admitted for evaluation. Surgical site is clean with no signs of infection. Patient's pain is localized to the abdomen, unrelated to the back surgery.

items.substring: Patient presented with severe abdominal pain and was admitted for evaluation.

description: Patient readmitted with respiratory distress unrelated to surgical complications.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient was readmitted with respiratory distress. Evaluation reveals pneumonia, completely unrelated to recent scoliosis surgery. Surgical site remains intact and healing well.

items.substring: Patient was readmitted with respiratory distress.

description: Patient develops urinary retention unrelated to surgical intervention post scoliosis surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Post-operative patient developed urinary retention. Imaging and bladder scan show no complications related to back surgery. Patient had pre-existing bladder issues.

items.substring: Post-operative patient developed urinary retention.

description: Patient admitted for an unrelated GI complication following scoliosis surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient presents with abdominal distension and was found to have an ileus. No signs of infection or issues at surgical site. This complication is unrelated to the recent scoliosis procedure.

items.substring: Patient presents with abdominal distension and was found to have an ileus.

description: Patient with increased back pain due to a pre-existing condition, not related to surgery.

notes.author: MD
notes.text: Patient reports increased back pain but evaluation shows no hardware issues or infection. Pain is attributed to a pre-existing condition and not related to the recent procedure.

items.substring: Patient reports increased back pain but evaluation shows no hardware issues.
